episodes.title: Brewing Big Beers - Brewing With Style 02-23-17
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: We get a lot of questions about how to brew quality beers with a higher gravity. Sometimes the questions are simple, and other times they can be kind of complex. Today, we put our heads together and lay out everything you need to know about how to brew these big beers - fermentation, recipe formulation, mashing, and more!

episodes.title: Heretic Barrel Program - Brewing With Style 01-24-17
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing With Style, we have a special guest join the show - the head of the Heretic Brewing Barrel Program, Chris!  He came into the studio to talk about how he made his transition from homebrewer all the way to his current position alongside Jamil.  We also chat about how he approaches blending and tasting beers from the barrel project, and how those get transformed into a final product. Tune in and learn about how Heretic tackles this complex and experimental part of producing great craft beer from barrels.

episodes.title: Mashing Dark Malts - Brewing With Style 01-10-17
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Today's show is full of a few things, but mainly beer.  We talk today about the practice of adding your dark malts at the end of the mash versus keeping them in there for the entire thing.  It's a much-debated topic, with many people on either side swearing to their cats that their way is the best.  JP brewed two batches of his Oatmeal Stout, one with grains at the mash and one with the dark grains added at the end.  Which will dominate?  Find out!

episodes.title: Listener Questions - Brewing With Style 12-27-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty take listener questions on this episode of Brewing With Style. Listen in as they answer all things beer from your emails.

episodes.title: Pete Slosberg - Brewing With Style 12-13-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty get a surprise visit from Pete Slosberg, formerly of Pete's Wicked Ales, and his friend Ari. Ari makes some of the best homemade bread we've ever had and shared some bread making tips with us. Pete brought us his homemade malt balls and a drink made with some amazonian berries that made your mouth go weird. We also discussed what makes a beer a given style and a few other beery things with our two friends in this special episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: Secret Beers Part 2 - Brewing With Style 11-15-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: We had so much fun with the last Secret Beers show that we had to come back with a Part Two.  Beevo brings Jamil, Tasty, and JP two mystery beers during the show, and it's up to our brave hosts to guess the style.  Which is much harder than it seems!  This exercise is a good one to try at home, because it really tests your beer knowledge.

episodes.title: Collaboration Beers - Brewing With Style 11-01-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty, and JP have been lucky enough to have done several collaboration beers over the years with friends and colleagues alike.  With more and more breweries reaching out into the homebrewing world for ProAm collaborations, and various "fun-to-brew" beers, they decided to use this episode of Brewing With Style to talk about the complex world of the collaboration beer.  The guys discuss what to expect from your brew day, what is expected from you, and how to the the most out of this amazing experience.  Plus they make fun of Beevo a lot.  Again.

episodes.title: Secret Beers - Brewing With Style 10-24-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil starts this episode of Brewing With Style by talking about Beevo's love for Brad at Brewer's Hardware.  Needless to say she's uncomfortable with it, which is always funny.  Then we jump right into the topic for today - Secret Beers!  We had two beers chosen for us secretly before the show, and our goal is to try and guess what styles these beers fall under.  It's harder than it sounds!  JP and Tasty come up with some crazy guesses, and Jamil ... well he does what you'd expect him to.

episodes.title: GABF 2016 Recap - Brewing With Style 10-04-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary:
Jamil, Tasty, and JP talk about the recent happenings at the Great American Beer Festival, including beers, judging, and all the work that goes into putting on a giant beer fest.  Well, Jamil and Tasty talk about it, since JP didn't go.
We talk a lot about the judging side of the GABF and just how much time it takes to run through all of the entries to pick the winners, not to mention the toll it takes on your body.  Most people don't know it's an 8-hour work day, and Jamil reminds us of that.  It's a good insight into the other side of a beer competition.

episodes.title: Foreign Extra Stout - Brewing With Style 09-26-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Coming off of Jamil's recent trip to Asia, we decided to revisit the Foreign Extra Stout category. Notoriously hard to find in the U.S. Jamil was able to track down some pretty neat beer and mule them back for us - including Guinness's version! We all had a clear favorite in the studio, which makes it even more painful to know that it will be nearly impossible to find on our side of the pond.  Oh well, such is beer!

episodes.title: Trappist Single Ale - Brewing With Style 09-06-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: We open the show today waxing poetic about how old Jamil is getting and how he has forgotten so much stuff that he has to refer to his own books to remind him of certain things.  Then we jump into today's style, Trappist Single Ale (category 26A in the 2015 BJCP guidelines), which was another style requested by a listener looking for more information on this hard-to-find style.  Needless to say, we were not able to have any of the classic styles for this show, but we did find a beer that came very, very close from Monkish.

episodes.title: Czech Amber Lager - Brewing With Style 08-16-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: We had a listener email into the show asking for us to cover something called Czech Amber Lager (category 3c in the new BJCP guidelines).  Having never had a commercial example of this beer, it was a challenge we quickly accepted!  First off, though, we discuss what it means to have a commercial example ready, and how that affects the ability to understand and interpret the BJCP guidelines.  After a bit of banter about the regionalism inferred by the name, we dig into the closest commercial beers we can find that may fall into the Czech Lager category.

episodes.title: Black IPA- Brewing With Style 08-09-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, JP and Tasty revisit Category 5 - Bock Beer, from the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines. Based on listener submissions of homebrew and commercial beer, the team goes through what makes a great bock beer and how you can brew one yourself.

episodes.title: Bock Beer Revisited- Brewing With Style 07-25-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, JP and Tasty revisit Category 5 - Bock Beer, from the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines. Based on listener submissions of homebrew and commercial beer, the team goes through what makes a great bock beer and how you can brew one yourself.

episodes.title: Dry Yeast vs. Liquid - Brewing With Style 07-19-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Prompted from listener questions, in this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, JP, and Tasty discuss the use of dry yeast to ferment your beer, vs. liquid yeast. They talk about the presence of diacetyl and how to properly use dry yeast to get the best fermentation you can. They also discuss new hops and why you should try them.

episodes.title: Altbier - Brewing With Style 06-28-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss Northern German Altbier, Category 7A in the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines. This is one of Jamil's favorite German styles, and sometimes it's hard to find a great example in the U.S. Tune in and learn about the complexities of a great German Alt, what commercial examples you might find success with, and of course, how to brew your own!

episodes.title: NHC 2016 - Brewing With Style 06-24-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this special episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty, JP and Beevo recap the 2016 National Homebrewers Conference in Baltimore, MD. Now known as Homebrew Con, this annual event draws thousands of homebrewers for an epic week of parties, seminars, special events and the largest homebrew competition on earth. Listen in as the guys tell their stories about everyone’s favorite event and learn what Homebrew Con is all about...

episodes.title: Maibock/Helles Bock - Brewing With Style 05-17-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss Maibock/Helles Bock, Category 5A in the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines. This awesome German style of beer is slightly toasty while remaining clean and easy to drink, even as its alcohol content is a little on the higher side. Listen in as the guys discuss their favorite commercial versions and how you can brew the perfect Maibock yourself!

episodes.title: Northern English Brown - Brewing With Style 05-03-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss Northern English Brown Ale, Category 11C of the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines. This wonderful English ale has subtle complexities to challenge the brewer, and is such a classic style, perfect for any occasion.  Tune in and learn about commercial examples and how to brew one yourself!

episodes.title: Pyment - Brewing With Style 04-19-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss Pyment, Category 25B from the 2008 BJCP Guidelines. Pyment is a melomel type of mead, generally made from grapes (juice). These can be very difficult to find commercially, but are still very common in homebrew circles. Tune in and learn the intricacies of producing pyment and how you can make a great one at home.

episodes.title: Specialty Beers - Brewing With Style 04-05-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss Category 23 from the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines; Specialty Beers. This category was created to give judges guidelines to evaluate beers that don't fit into any traditional categories and include experimental ingredients and techniques. Specialty adjuncts, combinations of other styles and historical or indigenous beers are just some examples of the category. Jamil and Tasty walk you through some examples that define the segment and give tips and tricks on how you can homebrew your own.

episodes.title: Straight Lambic - Brewing With Style 03-22-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss the often misunderstood style, Straight Lambic, category 17D in the BJCP Guidelines. As the sour beer craze races on, straight lambic remains the foundation and staple of the sour beer world. This unblended, historic example of beer that is produced with wild yeast and bacteria, can hold up for years if cared for properly and offers beer fans a unique experience and small step into the world of sour beer. Tune in and learn how they are made, which commercial examples are worth trying, and how you can homebrew or craft brew one yourself.

episodes.title: American IPA - Brewing With Style 03-08-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss American IPA, Category 14B in the 2008 BJCP Style Guidelines. This style has obviously become the darling of the craft beer world and typically outsells any other offering from American craft breweries. Dominated by a strong hop presenceand varying American hop varieties, this beer has taken the craft beer world by storm. Tune in and learn about just a few of the great examples available commercially, and you can homebrew a great example at home.

episodes.title: American Amber Ale - Brewing With Style 02-23-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss American Amber Ale, BJCP Category 10B (in the 2008 guidelines). While beer geeks are often hard on this style today as too bland, this was one of the pioneers of the craft beer movement, offering a full flavored gateway beer to new craft beer fans across the U.S.. Today, the style still holds up as a quality example of American craft beer. Tune in and learn more about commercial examples of this style, as well as how to homebrew one yourself.

episodes.title: Premium American Lager - Brewing With Style 02-09-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty welcome special guest Mitch Steele, Brewmaster at Stone Brewing Company, to the show to help evaluate Premium American Lager (BJCP Category 1C in 2013 Guidelines). Mitch worked for Anheuser  Busch for some time before switching over to the craft scene, so really knows this style well and helps walk us through what makes a great example of the beer. Tune in and see if the guys can tell which brand is which in a blind test and find out how you can make one at home as well so you can please your non-crafty friends.

episodes.title: Belgian Specialty Ale - Brewing With Style 01-26-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP Category 16E (2008 Guidelines) - Belgian Specialty Ale. This category can really run the gamut in terms of style and is typically characterized with fruity esters and spicy phenols. The beer can include spice additions, as well as wild yeast like Brettanomyces and/or Lactobacillus. Tune in and learn about our hosts favorite commercial examples, as well as recipes to brew your own.

episodes.title: Scottish Ale - Brewing With Style 01-12-16
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP Category 14 (in the 2015 guidelines) - Scottish Ale. Tune in and learn about Scottish Light, Heavy, and Export, as the guys walk you through what makes a great commercial example and how you can homebrew a great example yourself.

episodes.title: Vienna Lager - Brewing With Style 12-15-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP Category 3A - Vienna Lager. This classic German style is hard to find nowadays at Craft Breweries, but some classic examples still exist and occasionally you can find a local gem. Learn about the style, great commercial examples and what it takes to homebrew one yourself.

episodes.title: Foreign Extra Stout - Brewing With Style 12-09-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP Category 16D  - Foreign Extra Stout. This robust beer is rich, roasty and fruity, and is a true work of art when done right. Tune in and learn about commercial examples, as well as how you can homebrew one yourself.

episodes.title: Belgian Golden Strong - Brewing With Style 11-30-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP style 1A - Light American Lager. Best known for examples from the large American macro breweries, this style has endured as the most popular American style of beer by volume. With very little in terms of big flavor to hide behind, it is a challenging style to brew and get right in keeping to its very clean lager characteristics. Tune in and listen to the guys evaluate commercial examples, as well as talk about how you can homebrew one at home.

episodes.title: American Light Lager - Brewing With Style 11-03-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP style 1A - Light American Lager. Best known for examples from the large American macro breweries, this style has endured as the most popular American style of beer by volume. With very little in terms of big flavor to hide behind, it is a challenging style to brew and get right in keeping to its very clean lager characteristics. Tune in and listen to the guys evaluate commercial examples, as well as talk about how you can homebrew one at home.

episodes.title: Best Bitter - Brewing With Style 10-20-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Brewing with Style, Jamil and Tasty cover BJCP Category 8B, Special/ Best/ Premium Bitter. Tune in and learn about this traditional  style, as well as what commercial examples to seek and how to brew a great version of your own.

episodes.title: Berliner Weisse - Brewing With Style 10-06-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Brewing with Style, Jamil and Tasty cover Berliner Weisse. Tune in and learn about this traditional and refreshing style, what commercial examples to seek and how to brew a great version of you own.

episodes.title: Other Smoked Beer - Brewing With Style 09-22-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style Jamil and Tasty McDole discuss BJCP Category 6D - American Wheat or Rye Beer. This is one of those styles with a wide interpretation, but also difficult to make with nothing to hide behind. Clean fermentation and a delicate balance of malt and low hop bitterness, combined with a light color, make this beer wonderful when done right, but difficult to do so. Tune in and learn about commercial examples, how to homebrew one yourself, and what makes the style so popular.

episodes.title: American Wheat - Brewing With Style 09-17-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style Jamil and Tasty McDole discuss BJCP Category 6D - American Wheat or Rye Beer. This is one of those styles with a wide interpretation, but also difficult to make with nothing to hide behind. Clean fermentation and a delicate balance of malt and low hop bitterness, combined with a light color, make this beer wonderful when done right, but difficult to do so. Tune in and learn about commercial examples, how to homebrew one yourself, and what makes the style so popular.

episodes.title: Irish Red Ale - Brewing With Style 08-25-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP Category 9D, Irish Red Ale, in this episode of Brewing With Style. A very traditional style and a favorite of many beer lovers, Irish Red Ale is wonderful beer with subtle complexities that can make or break any version. Tune in and learn about great craft beer commercial examples and tips on how to brew your own.

episodes.title: Biere de Garde - Brewing With Style 08-11-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty discuss BJCP Category 16D, Biere de Garde, on this episode of Brewing With Style. This one is tricky because the colors and flavors of this style can really run the gamut. Jamil does his best to rein us in and focus on the nuances of this style so you can brew a great craft beer.

episodes.title: NHC2 - Brewing With Style 07-21-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty broadcast live from the National Homebrewers Conference in San Diego in part two of this two part series. Learn about what styles to bring to homebrew beer festivals and how to get the most out of sharing your beer in this on-location episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: NHC1 - Brewing With Style 07-07-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty broadcast live from the National Homebrewers Conference in San Diego in part one of this two part series. Learn about styles and yeast as Chris White from White Labs joins the show.

episodes.title: Weizenbock - Brewing With Style 06-22-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style Jamil, Tasty and Justin discuss Category 15C, Weizenbock. Tune in and learn about this traditional German style and what makes it so unique. Plus, Justin professes to hate the style, will that stick after some stellar examples are tasted? Tune in and find out.

episodes.title: Cider - Brewing With Style 06-02-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty and Justin discuss BJCP Categories  27 - 28, Cider, in this episode of Brewing With Style. Tune in as they try ciders from the different categories and discuss what makes a great cider, with extra focus on how to brew one yourself at home.

episodes.title: Old Ale - Brewing With Style 05-19-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty, and guest host Justin Crossley, discuss BJCP Category 19A, Old Ale. This is one of Jamil's favorites when done right and he teaches us a thing our two about what done right means. Tune in and learn about the subtle malty nuances that make this beer shine, and how you can homebrew one yourself.

episodes.title: Cream Ale - Brewing With Style 05-05-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Brewing With Style talks about category 6A from the BJCP Guidelines, Cream Ale. This often misunderstood style is an American classic and can be a real crowd pleaser with your friends, as well as excel in competition if done right. Tune in and find out about quality commercial examples, as well as how to homebrew your own.

episodes.title: Belgian Specialty Ale - Brewing With Style 04-21-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise cover BJCP Category 16E in this episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: Northern English Brown - Brewing With Style 04-07-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss Northern BJCP category 11C, Northern English Brown Ale, in this episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: Gueuze - Brewing With Style 03-24-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss Category 17E, Gueuze. This complex sour beer is a little acidic and a little tart, and can feature many of the "barnyard" notes that wild beer lovers enjoy. Learn about traditional commercial examples as well as newcomers to the scene and how to brew one yourself!

episodes.title: American Lager - Brewing With Style 03-10-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty on Jon Plise discuss American Lager in this episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: American Stout - Brewing With Style 02-24-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: The BWS crew discusses BJCP Category 13E, American Stout, in this episode for Brewing With Style. Tune in and learn about this unique American style of beer that runs the gamut in terms of complex roast, chocolate, coffee and more. Find out who is making the best commercial examples and techniques to brew your own.

episodes.title: Kolsch - Brewing With Style 02-10-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss category 6C: Kolsch. This is another Brewcaster favorite that is very hard to find in America. Technically only brewed in Cologne, Germany, this crisp, dry and clean style is a great sessionable beer that's light on the palette and difficult to brew well for novice brewers. Tune in and find out what makes Kolsch such a fan favorite.

episodes.title: Belgian Tripel - Brewing With Style 01-27-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style the crew discuss BJCP category 18C, Belgian Tripel. This big and complex Belgian style is a palette pleaser and a challenge to brew correctly. Tune in as the team discusses great commercial examples as well as techniques to brew your own.

episodes.title: Mild Ale - Brewing With Style 01-13-15
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style the crew discusses BJCP category 11A, Mild Ale. While this beer is difficult to find in the U.S. commercially, the brewcasters love it and discuss what makes it such a great, traditional style of beer to brew and drink.

episodes.title: Milk Stout - Brewing With Style 12-16-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Jon and Tasty discuss Milk Stout on this episode of Brewing with Style. Learn all about the style, commercial examples and how you can brew your own version of this excellent sweet stout.

episodes.title: Spice Beer - Brewing With Style 12-02-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing with Style, Jamil, Jon and Tasty discuss category 21A, Spice Beer, with a focus on Christmas spice beers. Tune in and find out what makes a great spice beer for the holidays and what favorites the Brewcasters have.

episodes.title: Mead - Brewing With Style 11-18-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Jon and Tasty welcome veteran meadmaker Michael Fairbrother from Moonlight Meadery to the show to discuss category's 24 - 16, Mead. Michael makes some of the best Mead on earth and shares his experiences here so you can learn how to make it, what types of honey will bode well, and what commercial examples you can find to steer you in the right direction.

episodes.title: Fruit Lambic - Brewing With Style 11-04-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: A Brewing Network staff favorite, Category 17F Fruit Lambic is discussed on this episode of Brewing With Style. If you love funky and sour beer then this is the one for you. With tons of modern and classic examples available, this one is sure to please even the most discerning palettes. Tune in and learn all about it with Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise.

episodes.title: Maibock - Brewing With Style 10-21-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Jon and Tasty discuss category 5A, Maibock, on this episode of Brewing With Style. Tune in and learn why this is one of Jamil's favorites, how you can brew it, and what commercial examples will put you on the right track.

episodes.title: Schwarzbier - Brewing With Style 10-07-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Brewing With Style welcomes brewmaster Christian Kazakoff of Iron Springs Brewery and homebrewer Jeremy Pendrey as the crew discusses their GABF Pro-Am Schwarzbier and covers the style in-depth, live from The Hop Grenade.

episodes.title: Belgian Dubbel - Brewing With Style 09-23-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, jon and Tasty discuss Belgian Dubbel on this episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: Munich Dunkel - Brewing With Style 09-09-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, jon and Tasty discuss Munich Dunkel on this episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: Brown Porter - Brewing With Style 08-26-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing with Style, Jamil, Jon and Tasty discuss Brown Porter.

episodes.title: Dark American Lager - Brewing With Style 08-12-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing with Style, Jamil, Jon and Tasty discuss Dark American Lager

episodes.title: English Barleywine - Brewing With Style 07-22-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Jon Plise and Tasty discuss English Barleywine

episodes.title: IIPA - Brewing With Style 07-08-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Brewing With Style covers Unapologetic, the Stone/Heretic/Beachwood collaboration Double IPA using all new hop varieties! Join Jamil, Tasty, and Jon Plise as they discuss their take on the style with Stone's Mitch Steele and Beachwood's Julian Shrago.

episodes.title: Saison - Brewing With Style 06-17-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing with Style, the crew discussed Siason.

episodes.title: Munich Helles - Brewing With Style 06-03-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise tackle Munich Helles in this episode of Brewing with Style.

episodes.title: Dunkelweizen - Brewing With Style 05-20-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: The Brewing With Style discusses BJCP category 15B, Dunkelweizen, on this episode. Tune in and learn about the German Wheat Beer style and what makes Dunkelweizen so interesting. Learn about commercial examples and brewing techniques so you can homebrew your own.

episodes.title: Flanders Red - Brewing With Style 05-06-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: The Brewing With Style team discusses BJCP Category 17B, Flanders Red. A Brewcaster favorite, this style is a true wonder in the beer world. Learn about what makes Flanders Red so unique, what commercial examples measure up, and techniques to homebrew your own.

episodes.title: Wood Aged Beer - Brewing With Style 04-22-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss category 22C of the BJCP Style Guidelines, Wood Aged Beer. Learn about the many variations of this craft beer style and tips on how to homebrew your own.

episodes.title: Gordon Strong on Styles - Brewing With Style 04-08-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Jon and Tasty welcome famed homebrewer and BJCP President Gordon Strong to discuss the beer style guidelines and how they are interpreted.

episodes.title: Spice, Herb or Vegetable Beer - Brewing With Style 03-25-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Justin joins Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise to talk about Spice, Herb or Vegetable Beer, Style 21A in the BJCP Guidelines. This beer used to be the one that judges avoided but has seen an uptick in recent years as brewers have become more skilled at their craft. Tune in and learn about great commercial examples and how to brew one yourself.

episodes.title: Bohemian Pilsner - Brewing With Style 03-11-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Justin joins Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise to talk about a team favorite, Bohemian Pilsner. This classic style resonates with brewers as a historical craft beer that pleases the palate and challenges the brewer to be aware of its subtleties. From Pilsner Urquel, to more modern examples, tune in and find out what makes a Bo Pils great and how to brew one at home.

episodes.title: Baltic Porter - Brewing With Style 02-25-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This time on Brewing With Style the crew discusses the Baltic Porter style of craft beer. Tune in and learn about this old and wonderful style of beer that is big on flavor, complex on the palate, and great to drink when brewed right.

episodes.title: Blonde Ale - Brewing With Style 02-11-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing With Style, the guys discuss the craft beer style of Blonde Ale. Simple and elegant, this style requires precision brewing and a knack for the understated, which is not to be mistaken for lacking flavor. When done correctly, this style will please them all and give you a winner as a homebrewer or a professional. Tune in and find out how to brew it yourself and find commercial examples to try.

episodes.title: Rauchbier - Brewing With Style 01-28-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing With Style, special guest Mitch Steele of Stone Brewing Company joins Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise to discuss Rauchbier. Challenging to find and even harder to make well, this is a style that is not for the faint of heart, showcasing big smoke flavors and a malt-forwardness that lends itself well to pairing with rich, meaty foods. Despite the difficulty in obtaining commercial examples, tune in to see which ones the crew has chosen, and of course, tips on how to brew one yourself.

episodes.title: Belgian Pale Ale - Brewing With Style 01-14-14
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing With Style, special guest Mitch Steele of Stone Brewing Company joins Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise to discuss Belgian Pale Ale. This is a style that has really started to come into its own in recent years, as brewers have begun to master the difficult interplay of pronounced hop flavors with Belgian yeast characteristics. Tune in to hear about about some of the better commercial examples on the market, as well as how to homebrew a great one of your own.

episodes.title: Oatmeal Stout - Brewing With Style 12-17-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week on Brewing With Style Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss the often misunderstood Oatmeal Stout style of craft beer. This one can be confusing as brewers try to ramp up the wrong flavors missing the mark on a true Oatmeal Stout, not too mention the difficulty in using roasted malts without making an acrid beer. Homebrewers and pro's alike will enjoy hearing about versions done right and how to brew one yourself.

episodes.title: English IPA - Brewing With Style 11-19-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss the English IPA style of beer. This veteran style has come a long way since its inception and continues to be a favorite of craft beer fans and homebrewers. Known for it's English malts balanced with wonderful English hops, English IPA is the original IPA. Tune in and learn about great commercial examples as well as how to homebrew one yourself.

episodes.title: German Wheat - Brewing With Style 11-05-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss the beer style of German Wheat, or Weissbier. A very traditional Bavarian beer style, Weissbier showcases yeast esters and crisp drinkability, and is incredibly fun to homebrew. Tune in and learn about commercial examples as well as tips to brew your own.

episodes.title: Robust Porter - Brewing With Style 10-22-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss the style of Robust Porter. Tune in and learn about craft beer examples as well as how to homebrew your own.

episodes.title: Ordinary Bitter - Brewing With Style 10-08-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss the Ordinary Bitter style from the BJCP guidelines. Tune in and find out what makes this traditional English style so wonderful and challenging ti brew correctly.

episodes.title: Belgian Dark Strong - Brewing With Style 09-24-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style the guys discuss Belgian Dark Strong Ale. This complex, malty and historic ale is rich and malty, high in alcohol, and incredibly robust. Tune in and learn about great commercial craft beer examples, as well as how to homebrew a great version yourself.

episodes.title: California Common - Brewing With Style 09-10-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style the guys discuss California Common from the BJCP Style Guidelines. Often referred to as Steam Beer (think Anchor Steam) this style has a rich history in the US and when done right, is a crisp and refreshing beer that crosses the line between ale and lager. Tune in and learn tips on how to homebrew one yourself, as well as craft beer examples.

episodes.title: Oktoberfest - Brewing With Style 08-27-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise talk about the Oktoberfest style of beer. Learn homebrew techniques for the style, as well as craft beer examples that stand out.

episodes.title: Fruit Beer - Brewing With Style 08-13-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Jon Plise and Tasty discuss BJCP Style 20 - Fruit Beer. Tune in and learn about the various forms this style can take, as well as brewing techniques and commercial examples to help you make a better homebrew or craft beer.

episodes.title: Witbier - Brewing With Style 07-22-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise talk about the Witbier style. Learn about the intricacies and misconceptions of this unique style, as well as what are good and bad examples of it. Then hear tips on how to brew it yourself.

episodes.title: Dortmunder Export - Brewing With Style 07-02-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss the Dortmunder Export style of beer. This awesome German beer style is crisp and delicious, while also a challenge to brew well. Tune in and find out what the Brewcasters think are good craft beer examples and learn techniques for your homebrew.

episodes.title: Imperial IPA - Brewing With Style 06-18-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss the controversial Imperial IPA style of beer. This recent beer style is often interpreted many ways by many brewers. Tune in and find out what the Brewcasters think are good craft beer examples and learn techniques for your homebrew.

episodes.title: Dry Stout - Brewing With Style 06-04-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil and Tasty discuss the historic Dry Stout style of beer. A craft beer and homebrew favorite of beer lovers, this style has many commercial examples, but not all are up to the task. Tune in and find out what Jamil and Tasty like and tips on how to brew your own.

episodes.title: Doppelbock - Brewing With Style 05-21-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise talk about the German Doppelbock style of beer. This wonderful classic German lager is complex, malty and clean and is just amazing when brewed right. Tune in and learn about the style, craft beer examples, brewing techniques and more.

episodes.title: ESB - Brewing With Style 05-07-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise talk about the ESB style of beer. This wonderful traditional English style is a challenge to brew, but so rewarding when done right. Tune in and learn about the style, brewing techniques, commercial examples and more!

episodes.title: American Brown Ale - Brewing With Style 04-23-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise talk about American Brown Ale. A style near and dear to Brewing Network hearts, this robust and hoppy ale is a crown pleaser when done well. Tune in and hear how Tasty does it with his award winning homebrew recipe, and what commercial craft beer examples lead the pack.

episodes.title: Belgian Blonde Ale - Brewing With Style 04-09-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style. Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss Belgian Blonde Ale. Learn what makes a great Belgian Blonde Ale, including commercial examples brewing techniques. Also find out what beer the team recommends you go out and try.

episodes.title: American Barleywine - Brewing With Style 03-26-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing With Style. Jamil, Tasty and Jon Plise discuss American Barleywine. Learn what makes a great barleywine, including commercial examples brewing techniques. Also find out what beer the team recommends you go out and try.

episodes.title: German Pilsner - Brewing With Style 03-12-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brrewng With Style, Jamil, Tasty and Jon discuss German Pilsner. Tune in and learn about some of the best craft beer commercial examples, tips to homebrew your own and more in-depth discussion on the style.

episodes.title: Russian Imperial Stout - Brewing With Style 02-26-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Brewing with Style the crew talk about Russian Imperial Stout. Learn about the style, craft beer examples, what makes a good homebrew and more.

episodes.title: Pale Ale - Brewing With Style 02-05-13
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty are back with a brand new show, Brewing With Style! The homebrew guys are revisiting the style guidelines in a whole new light, but bringing back an old friend to help. Llearn all about Pale Ale and the new format in this first episode of Brewing With Style.

episodes.title: Wells Bombardier - Can You Brew It 08-27-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty enlist the help of Neil Spake to try and clone this classic English Bitter, Bombardier, from Wells. Listen to the brewer describe the beer to Neil and see if he was able to homebrew this wonderful ale.

episodes.title: Abita Turbodog - Can You Brew It 08-13-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, JP it challenged to homebrew Turbodog from Abita Brewing Company. This dark malty beer is a favorite for malt lovers with a clean finish and tons of flavor without any of the acrid roast qualities that some beers of this style exhibit. Tune in and see of JP was able to clone this great craft beer.

episodes.title: Eagle Rock Revolution XPA - Can You Brew It 07-30-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It the crew attempts to homebrew Eagle Rock Revolution XPA. This lighter version of an American Pale Als is bright and refreshing, with a strong hop presence. At 5.2% ABV and 37 IBU's, this golden beer is delicate, but not thin or watery. It's truly a great example of a hop friendly craft beer that's not overbearing. Tune in and see if the crew was able to clone it!

episodes.title: Ska Brewing Modus Hoperandus - Can You Brew It 07-16-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It?, the crew attempts to homebrew Ska Brewing Company's Modus Hoperandi American Style IPA. This beer has huge hop piney flavor and deep bitterness, but finishes smooth and leaves you wanting more. Tune in and see if Tasty was able to clone this amazing beer from Ska, and get the recipe to try it yourself!

episodes.title: Stone Arrogant Bastard 4 - Can You Brew It 07-02-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this live episode from the 2012 National Homebrewers Conference in Seattle, WA., Can You Brew It welcomes Stone Brewmaster Mitch Steel back to the show for another attempt at homebrewing a clone of Arrogant Bastard. This elusive beer finds Mitch tight lipped once again about the recipe, leaving Tasty to keep experimenting with the grain bill to get it right. Tune in and see what Mitch has to say about this version!

episodes.title: Lagunitas Hop Stoopid - Can You Brew It 06-18-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, live from the 2012 National Homebrewers Conference in Seattle, WA., the crew welcomes Lagunitas Brewmaster Jeremy Marshal to the show. For this challenge, Tasty tries to homebrew a clone of Lagunitas Hop Stoopid and has Jeremy try it in front of the live audience to decide if the beer is cloned. Tune in and hear Jeremy talk about the beer and find out if Tasty got it right!

episodes.title: Ladyface Porter - Can You Brew It 05-21-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It Kim Wood is enlisted to homebrew a clone of Ladyface Porter from Ladyface Ale Companie in Agoura Hills California. This craft beer is a brewcaster favorite and even if you can;t try the commercial version, the recipe is awesome. Tune in and see if Kim was able to clone it!

episodes.title: Ska Brewing Mexican Logger - Can You Brew It 05-07-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, the crew enlists JP to attempt a clone of Ska Brewing's Mexican Logger. JP is a big fan of this beer and was definitely up for the challenge. Tune in and find out if he was able to hombrew this great craft beer from Colorado.

episodes.title: Kern River Citra DIPA - Can You Brew It 04-23-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone Citra Double IPA from Kern River Brewing Company in Kernville, CA. This wonderful craft beer took gold at the Great American Beer Festival in 2011 and has racked up many other awards as one of the best double IPA's on earth. Tune in and find out if Tasty was able to homebrew this hop monster of a beer.

episodes.title: Repeat-ability - Can You Brew It 04-09-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty discuss repeat-ability in your homebrewing. In order to make clones of great craft beer, you need to be able to repeat your own brews. Jamil and Tasty give you their top tips to cloning your own hombrew in order to improve you ability to clone others.

episodes.title: No Recipe Cloning - Can You Brew It 03-26-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, Tasty and Jamil talk about homebrewing your favorite craft beer without knowing the recipe. It's hard enough to brew these great beers when we have the recipe, but what do the guys do when they don't? Tune in and learn tasting and brewing techniques to help you clone all your favorites.

episodes.title: Extract Cloning - Can You Brew It 03-12-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It Jamil and Tasty talk about cloning commercial craft beer by using extract instead of all grain. So many homebrewers, beginning and advanced, like to use extract as their malt bill and that shouldn't keep you from trying to clone your favorite commercial beers. Jamil and Tasty guide you through techniques to do just that on this CYBI!

episodes.title: Flying Dog Raging Bitch - Can You Brew It 02-27-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: The Can You Brew It crew enlists listener favorite Kim Wood for another crack at craft beer cloning. This time Kim is challenged to homebrew Belgian style IPA, Raging Bitch, from Flying Dog Brewery. This is a great example of a hybrid style of beer that is difficult to master with hop bitterness fitting in with Belgian yeast flavors, but Flying Dog has done it well. Tune in and see if Kim can do the same.

episodes.title: Ommegang Rare Vos - Can You Brew It 02-13-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewer Mike Mraz is back on Can You Brew It to attempt to homebrew Ommegang's Rare Vos. Rare Vos is a Belgian Amber Ale of sorts that is bold, complex and challenging to brew just right. Like many Belgian styles the yeast choice is important, as is the malt bill on this great craft beer. Tune in and find out if Mraz was able to nail another clone for CYBI.

episodes.title: Uinta Dubhe - Can You Brew It 01-30-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Can You Brew It the crew attempts to homebrew Uinta Dubhe, Imperial Black Ale. To get the job done the crew brings back our complex beer all star, Mike Mraz. Tune in and find out if Mike was able to brew this craft beer right at home.

episodes.title: Eagle Rock Solidarity - Can You Brew It 01-16-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Can You Brew It the team attempts to homberew Los Angeles favorite. Solidarity Black Mild, from Eagle Rock Brewing. Jamil and Tasty enlist Matt Staley (of Taffelbully fame) to brew this one. Tune in and see if Matt was able to make this great craft beer.

episodes.title: Uinta Wyld - Can You Brew It 01-02-12
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: This week's Can You Brew It challenge is Uinta Brewing's Wyld Organic Extra Pale Ale. Wyld is a lighter bodied pale ale that is aggressively hopped to showcase fresh hop flavors. It's a delicate beer to get right, but worth it for an easy drinking hop flavor forward pale. Tune in and see if the CYBI crew was able to get it right.

episodes.title: Heretic Tafelbully - Can You Brew It 12-19-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Chris Kennedy from Heretic Brewing Co. joins another reverse Can You Brew It and talks about his pro-am beer with homebrewer Matt Staley. Tune in and find out about Tefelbully and if Chris and Jamil were able to clone it on a professional scale.

episodes.title: Iron Springs - Can You Brew It 12-05-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Christian Kazakoff from Iron Springs Pub and Brewery joins another reverse Can You Brew It and talks about his pro-am beer with homebrewer Alan Atha from the Sonoma Beerocrats. Tune in and find out about the beer and if Christian was able to clone it on a professional scale.

episodes.title: Plise Returns - Can You Brew It 11-21-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In another twist for Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty bring back Brewing Network co-founder Jon Plise to talk about the history of the show and what Jon has been doing since the original Jamil Show ended. Tune in and find out about our old friend Jon and the Plise winery.

episodes.title: Laurel IPA - Can You Brew It 11-07-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In a twist for Can You Brew It, the crew talks to Brewmaster Roger Davis from Triple Rock about cloning a homebrew recipe on a pro scale. This time Roger worked with homebrewer turned pro, Julian Shrago on his Laurel IPA for Triple Rock. Find out the secrets to up-scaling a homebrew and learn all about Laurel IPA!

episodes.title: The Dankness - Can You Brew It 10-24-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In a twist for Can You Brew It, the crew talks to Brewmaster Roger Davis from Triple Rock about cloning a homebrew recipe on a pro scale. Roger worked with homebrewer Nathan Smith on his uber hoppy IPA called The Dankness for Triple Rock and also to enter as a pro-am entry into the Great American Beer Festival. Find out the secrets to up-scaling a homebrew and learn all about The Dankness!

episodes.title: Pro-Am Beers - Can You Brew It 10-10-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Can You Brew It the team reverses the process and talks about professional craft brewers making homebrew recipes in their breweries. Following the growing trend of pro-am beers in America, Tasty McDole and Jamil Zainasheff talk about what it takes to scale a homebrew recipe up to pro size and still clone the original beer.

episodes.title: 21st Amendment Back in Black - Can You Brew It 09-26-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Can You Brew It, the team attempts to homebrew Back in Black from the 21st Amendment Brewery in San Francisco. This rich, robust and hoppy craft beer is a wonderful example of a black IPA and is available fresh in many locations due to the use of cans as 21A's preferred form of packaging. Kim Wood joins the team once again to attempt this clone. Tune in and find out if she is able to brew it!

episodes.title: Pizza Port Shark Bite Red - Can You Brew It 09-12-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Can You Brew It, Tasty and Jamil take a shot at homebrewing Pizza Port Shark Bite Red. Over the past several years Pizza Port has dominated the Great American Beer Festival, and the California beer scene, proving to be one of the best small craft breweries in America. Tasty accepts the challenge of brewing this beer at home. Tune in and hear Director of Brewing Operations Jeff Bagby talk about this wonderful beer and find out if Tasty McDole was able to brew it!

episodes.title: Wychwood Hobgoblin - Can You Brew It 08-29-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It the crew attempts to homebrew an international favorite from Wychwood Brewing in the UK. Guest brewer Kim Wood is challenged to clone Hobgoblin and joins the show once again to test her brewing skills. Tune in and find out if Kim was able to brew this rich, dark, toffee and chocolaty English ale.

episodes.title: The Bruery Rugbrod - Can You Brew It 08-15-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: On this episode of Can You Brew It Jamil and Tasty welcome homebrewer Matt Staley to the show to try and clone Rugbrod from The Bruery in Placentia, CA. This craft beer is bold and very tasty and is s true challenge to homebrew. Tune in and see if Matt and the crew are able to brew it!

episodes.title: What Have You Learned - Can You Brew It 08-01-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Jamil and Tasty take you down memory lane in this episode of Can You Brew It, as they polish the gems of info they have learned over the years of doing CYBI.  They talk about recipe formulation, yeast selection, and even water chemistry.

episodes.title: Yeast Selection and Harvesting - Can You Brew It 07-18-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty talk about how to select the right yeast for your craft beer clones.  They also explain the best methods of culturing yeast from craft beer bottles, and how to use that in your homebrew.  Jamil and Tasty review methods of choosing and selecting the right yeast for the right home brewed beer.

episodes.title: Live from NHC - Can You Brew It 06-17-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Brew Strong, live from the 2011 National Homebrewers Conference, Mitch Steele from Stone Brewing Co. in San Diego joins tasty and Jamil to officially taste and judge if Tasty's Arrogant Bastard clone attempt is cloned or not. We also let the live audience taste the beers and vote if they think it is cloned or not. Tune in and find out if Tasty got this great craft beer right this time!

episodes.title: Process Cloning - Can You Brew It 05-09-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In the second part of the Can You Brew It, How to Clone series, Jamil and Tasty discuss the brewing process and techniques when trying to clone commercial beers. Tune in and get all the steps they take to hombrew craft beer right.

episodes.title: Avery Maharaja - Can You Brew It 04-25-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It? the team enlists Chad Moshier to attempt a homebrew clone of craft beer fan favorite, Avery Maharaja. This huge Imperial IPA from Avery Brewing Company in Colorado is bold, hoppy, malty and seriously high octane. It's a great beer and a challenging brew. Tune in and see if Chad was able to make it!

episodes.title: Recipe Cloning - Can You Brew It 04-11-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty take a step back and describe how recipes are derived, adjusted, calculated and executed when attempting to homebrew craft beer. They discuss how even when a brewer gives a recipe, adjustments must be made to brew at home, and why. Tune in and hear how the team goes through a beer, from tasting to recipe, and figures out how to brew it at home.

episodes.title: Boont Amber - Can You Brew It 03-28-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, the crew attempts to clone Boont Amber from Anderson Valley Brewing Company. This bay area staple craft beer has helped define the amber category and has recently been updated by new Brewmaster, Fal Allen. Listen in to Fal describe the beer and find out if the crew was able to clone this in a homebrew.

episodes.title: Shakespeare Rebrew - Can You Brew It 03-14-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. After a failed clone attempt the first time around, new Brewcaster Nathan Smith tries once more to brew Shakespeare Stout from Rogue. This wonderful craft beer stout is a challenge for any brewer to clone, but getting it right is a sweet reward. Listen and see what changes were made to the recipe and to hear if Nathan got his himebrew right this time around.

episodes.title: Meantime IPA - Can You Brew It 02-28-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It? the team attempts to brew Meantime IPA from London England. And by the team, we mean Justin. And by Justin we mean, great...can't wait to hear what he screwed up this time. Tune in and find out if Justin was able to break the cycle and brew this English IPA with a rich traditional background and great British appeal.

episodes.title: Meantime Porter - Can You Brew It 02-14-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In her first appearance on Can You Brew It, Brewing Network favorite Kim Wood joins the ranks to try and clone Meantime London Porter. This beer is based on a recipe from the 1750's and is a true historical London Porter that is heavy on the toffee, roasty coffee notes and chocolate, and provides a nice challenge for our first time cloner, Kim Wood. Tune in and see if she was able to homebrew this great English craft beer.

episodes.title: Lagunitas Maximus - Can You Brew It 01-17-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Back with another from one of our west coast favorites, the CYBI crew attempts to brew Lagunitas Maximus. This is not a beer to be taken lightly with its bold flavor, huge hops and malt, and incredible finish. You will want this on your kegerator while the winter chill is still with us. Tune in and find out if the crew was able to clone it!

episodes.title: Sierra Nevada Celebration - Can You Brew It 01-31-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The Can You Brew It? crew attempts to homebrew the very popular Celebration Ale from Sierra Nevada Brewing Company. Craft beer legend Steve Dresler, brewmaster at Sierra, tells us how to make the beer, but is that enough? Tune in and see if Tasty was able to craft this Brewcaster favorite.

episodes.title: Lagunitas Maximus - Can You Brew It 01-17-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Back with another from one of our west coast favorites, the CYBI crew attempts to brew Lagunitas Maximus. This is not a beer to be taken lightly with its bold flavor, huge hops and malt, and incredible finish. You will want this on your kegerator while the winter chill is still with us. Tune in and find out if the crew was able to clone it!

episodes.title: 8 Wired iStout - Can You Brew It 01-03-11
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The Can You Brew It team enlists Doc to attempt to homebrew this huge Russian Imperial Stout brimming with coffee and chocolate malt flavors. 8 Wired, a New Zealand Craft beer company, is responsible for this great winter warmer and does a great job crafting a rich and complex RIS. Tune in and see of Doc was able to clone this great brew.

episodes.title: Lagunitas Little Sumpin Sumpin - Can You Brew It 12-20-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It? Tasty is challenged to clone Little Sumpin Sumpin Ale from Lagunitas Brewing Company. This wheaty ale is hopped with several different hops to make a dry, hoppy summer style ale that is rich and complex, yet easy drinking and silky smooth. Listen in and see if Tasty was able to re-create this wonderful craft beer on his homebrew system.

episodes.title: Terrapin Wake N' Bake Stout - Can You Brew It 12-06-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It team attempts to homebrew a clone of Terrapin Wake N' Bake Coffee Oatmeal Imperial Stout. JP takes on the challenge of this popular, big, roasty and coffee filled stout. Tune in and hear Brewmaster Brian "Spike" Buckowski talk about his complex recipe and brew process and see if JP was able to clone this wonderful craft beer.
tags: wake n' bake coffee oatmeal imperial stout

episodes.title: Arrogant Bastard Re-brew - Can You Brew It 11-22-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The Can You Brew It crew tries once again to brew Stone Arrogant Bastard. This complex and illusive brew seems to come so close, yet so far every time, and the bar is set high. Listen in and find out if Tasty was able to homebrew this popular craft beer this time around..

episodes.title: Fullers Re-brews - Can You Brew It 11-08-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. After their first failed attempts, the Can You Brew It crew tries again to brew Fuller's London Pride and ESB. These two wonderful English beers are subtle in flavor, yet unique and specific in their brewing process and ingredients. Justin delivers fresh beer directly from the brewery after his trip to England to compare with the new clones. Tune in and see if Chad was able to get it right this time around.

episodes.title: Nebraska Brewing Cardinal Pale - Can You Brew It 10-25-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, the team attempts to clone Cardinal Pale Ale from Nebraska Brewing Company. Jamil found this beer on his travels across the country and fell in love with it. He then brought the beer to Tasty and challenged him to homebrew this wonderful craft beer. Tune in and find out if Tasty cloned it!

episodes.title: Fullers 1845 - Can You Brew It 10-11-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It the crew attempts to homebrew Fullers 1845. This 150 year commemorative ale is the epitome of English cask conditioned ale, with complex floral, spicy and nutty notes that make it one of the very best English exports we have found. Tune in and see if Nathan Smith was able to complete the challenge of brewing this wonderful beer.

episodes.title: Holgate Nut Brown Ale - Can You Brew It 09-27-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It we bring you back to Australia to visit with head brewer Ian Morgan from Holgate Brewery in Victoria, Australia. After Jamil's travels there earlier this year, he decided the beer was so good that he wanted to try and have it cloned for CYBI. Tune in and hear our friend Peter Symons interview Ian and see if the crew is able to homebrew this Australian craft beer.

episodes.title: Bridge Road Biere de Garde - Can You Brew It 09-13-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The Can You Brew It crew attempts to brew their first craft beer from New Zealand. After travelling in Australia and New Zealand, Jamil returns with a fond memory of the best pale ale he had on his journey, and a fine example of the style in general. Tune in and see if the crew was able to recreate this wonderful pale ale

episodes.title: Epic Pale Ale - Can You Brew It 08-30-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The Can You Brew It crew attempts to brew their first craft beer from New Zealand. After travelling in Australia and New Zealand, Jamil returns with a fond memory of the best pale ale he had on his journey, and a fine example of the style in general. Tune in and see if the crew was able to recreate this wonderful pale ale

episodes.title: Live From NHC 2010 - Can You Brew It 08-16-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This episode of Can You Brew It was recorded live at the 2010 National Homebrewers Conference in St. Paul Minnesota. Tasty and Jamil discuss things they have learned over the past year of clone brewing attempts that have helped them brew better beer and make more accurate clones. They also take questions from conference attendees on all things brewing.

episodes.title: Firestone Walker, DBA Re-brew - Can You Brew It 08-02-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. After one failed clone attempt, the Can You Brew It crew gives their clone of Firestone Walker's Double Barrel Ale another shot. This complex craft beer is difficult to nail down exactly due to it's delicate barrel flavor and aging process, but Tasty never shy's away from a challenge. Tune in and find out if the homebrew came out right the second time!

episodes.title: Firestone Walker, Union Jack - Can You Brew It 07-19-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Continuing the Firestone Walker series of brews, Can You Brew It attempts to homebrew Union Jack IPA in this episode. Our hop king, Tasty, is chosen as the brewer for this clone of one of our favorite west coast IPA's. This craft beer has won Gold at GABF two years in a row, and it is well deserved. Tune in and see of the crew was able to clone this beer. For the original interview with brewmaster Matt Brynildson about Union Jack, listen to the 6-7-10 episode.

episodes.title: Firestone Walker, Pale 31 - Can You Brew It 07-05-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It the team attempts to brew Firestone Walker's Pale 31. This west coast Pale Ale is a great example of the beer style and a favorite of all the Brewcasters. The team recruits Shat The Producer to homebrew this craft beer. Tune in and see if he is able to clone it. For the original interview with brewmaster Matt Brynildson, tune in to the 6-7-10 episode of CYBI.

episodes.title: Firestone Walker, Walkers Reserve - Can You Brew It 06-21-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this second episode of our Firestone series, the Can You Brew It crew attempts to clone Walkers Reserve from Firestone Walker. This is one of the best, and most complex stouts brewed on the west coast, and a favorite of The Brewing Network. CYBI enlists Jason "JP" Petros on this one. Tune in and find out if he cloned it.

episodes.title: Firestone Walker - Can You Brew It 06-07-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This week on Can You Brew It, the crew goes Firestone Walker crazy! Hear brewmaster Matt Brynildson talk about Walkers Reserve, Pale 31, Union Jack and Double Barrel Ale. This episode sets up a series of 4 more shows covering each beer and their clone attempts. Take your brewing notes here from Matt himself to keep with you for each beer's individual episode.

episodes.title: Fullers London Pride - Can You Brew It 05-24-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It the crew attempts to clone the great English ale, Fuller's London Pride. Jamil and Tasty recruit Shat The Producer to take on the task. The show serves as a follow up to the Fuller's ESB episode, as both beer are brewed together Party Gyle style. Tune in and find out if Shat was able to brew homebrew this wonderful craft beer.

episodes.title: Fullers ESB - Can You Brew It 05-10-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It the crew attempts to clone Fullers ESB. Our international correspondent Neil Spake travels to England to interview the brewmaster at Fullers and find out all the tips and tricks to brew this fine ale. Tune in and find out if the crew is able to clone it!

episodes.title: Re-Brew Morror Pond and Fish Alt - Can You Brew It 04-26-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In the first re-brew show to date, the CYBI crew attempts once again to clone Deschutes Mirror Pond Pale and and Fish Brewing's Eight Mile Alt. Tune in and see if the crew was able to get it right the second time! We also add in a special listener clone attempt of Elysian Night Owl Pumpkin Ale.

episodes.title: Nogne Porter - Can You Brew It 04-12-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone Nogne Porter. Nogne is a Norwegian brewery that is brewing and exporting some fine craft beers. This porter is complex with flavors of both coffee and dried fruit mixing to make a wonderful Porter. Tune in and hear brewer Kjetil Jikiun talk about how they brew the craft beer and then find out if the team was able to homebrew it!

episodes.title: Black Sheep Riggwelter - Can You Brew It 03-29-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty invite the help of writer and brewer Neil Spake to attempt a clone of Riggwelter Strong Yorkshire Ale by Black Sheep Brewery in the UK. Neil scored a great interview with the brewery for this one and brings a strong knowledge of English beer to the table to help clone this one. Tune in and find out if the guys were able to get it right.

episodes.title: Stone Old Guardian - Can You Brew It 03-15-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This week on Can You Brew It? the crew attempts to homebrew Stone Old Guardian Barleywine Style Ale. Once again, the crew brings in homebrewer and complex beer guru Mike Mraz to take on the challenge of this wonderful craft beer. Tune in and find out if Mike was able to brew it!

episodes.title: Captain Lawrence Smoked Porter - Can You Brew It 03-01-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This week on Can You Brew It? the crew attempts to homebrew Captain Lawrence Smoked Porter. Jason "JP" Petros takes on the challenge this time. Tune in and find out if JP can clone this great example of a smoked porter.

episodes.title: Nogne 100 - Can You Brew It 02-15-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It Jamil and Tasty take on a challenging beer from Norway's first craft brewery Nogne. Tasty is challenged to homebrew Nogne #100, a big bodied ale that is listed as a barleywine, but drinks like a hoppy imperial red. This craft beer is big and malty, and will surprise you with it's complexity of flavor while maintaining a simple recipe. Tune in and find out if Tasty was able to clone it!

episodes.title: Captain Lawrence Xtra Gold - Can You Brew It 02-01-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Tasty take on the challenge of homebrewing Captain Lawrence Xtra Gold in this episode of Can You Brew It. Homebrewer Nathan Smith is elected to brew this wonderful craft beer and try his luck at reproducing it. Scott Vaccaro, the brewmaster and owner at Captain Lawrence also joins the program to lend his guidance. Tune in and see if the crew is able to make it happen!

episodes.title: Terrapin Rye Pale Ale - Can You Brew It 01-18-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone Terrapin Beer Company's Rye Pale Ale. This craft beer is challenging to homebrew with its use of 5 varieties of hops and lots of specialty malts, creating a complex yet balanced Pale Ale. Tasty takes on the challenge this time around and gives his best effort. Tune in and find out if he can brew it

episodes.title: Stone Levitation Ale - Can You Brew It 01-04-10
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty are challenged to homebrew Stone Levitation Ale. This hoppy craft beer is a favorite of Jamil's and is both complex and challenging to brew. Mike Mraz joins the team once again to help with the beer and lends his insight to the style. Tune in and find out if the crew was able to complete the challenge.

episodes.title: Fish Brewing Eight Mile Alt - Can You Brew It 12-21-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It, the crew attempts to clone Eight Mile Alt by Fish Brewing Company in Olympia, WA. Brewmaster Tony Powell joins the show to describe the craft beer and the brewing process, and Tasty McDole tackles the homebrewing of this great German style Alt.

episodes.title: Northern Brewer Opening - Can You Brew It 12-07-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this special episode of The Jamil Show, Jamil and Justin head out to Milwaukee, WI. to help celebrate the grand opening of Northern Brewer's newest Midwest location on November 14th. Jamil does a live show from the new store and tries beers from local homebrewers. The Midwest homebrew scene is thriving and this episode shows some of the unique brewing that folks are doing, complete with input from the Pope of beer himself, Jamil Zainasheff.

episodes.title: Rogue Shakespeare Stout - Can You Brew It 11-23-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. On this episode of Can You Brew It, the crew takes on another fine craft beer from Rogue Ales; Shakespeare Stout. To help with the challenge, Stout master Jason Petros brews the clone, along with our favorite guest homebrewer Nathan Smith. Tune in and find out if the pair are able to homebrew this wonderful stout with all its complexities.

episodes.title: Dogfish Head 120 IPA - Can You Brew It 11-09-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. On this episode of Can You Brew It on The Brewing Network, Jamil and Tasty enlist the help of The Homebrew Chef Sean Paxton to attempt to clone Dogfish Head's 120 Minute IPA. Sean is an expert homebrewer, as well as chef, and was put to the challenge by our hosts because of experience with complex beer. Tune in and find out if Sean succeeds with this challenging brew!

episodes.title: Jolly Pumpkin Madrugada Obscura - Can You Brew It 10-26-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The CYBI crew is once again put to the test with another Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales challenge on The Brewing Network. This time the crew is asked to homebrew Madrugada Obscure (Dark Dawn). This complex craft beer is a Belgian-inspired stout that is dark, roasty and one of the most unique beers on earth. Once again CYBI enlists sour expert Mike Mraz to tackle the challenge. Can he brew it?

episodes.title: Jolly Pumpkin Bam Biere - Can You Brew It 10-12-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Some craft beers are difficult to reproduce. Others are near impossible. Reproducing anything that comes out of Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales is like winning the lottery! But the CYBI crew never backs down from a homebrewing challenge. Tune in and see if guest brewer Mike Mraz can clone Bam Biere from Jolly Pumpkin and complete the impossible!

episodes.title: Deschutes Mirror Pond - Can You Brew It 09-28-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Now here is a real twist on Can You Brew It!  The CYBI crew has challenged Justin (Brewcaster J) to brew one of his favorites, Mirror Pond Pale Ale by Deschutes Brewing. Tune in and hear brewer Jimmy Seifrits talk about this wonderful Pale Ale and find out if the worst brewer in the house can take his advice and re-create the beer. After all, if J can do it anyone can!

episodes.title: Magic Hat Roxy Rolles - Can You Brew It 09-14-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This week on CYBI the crew is challenged to clone Magic Hat's fall seasonal Roxy Rolles. This brewery happens to be an old favorite of Chad "The Producer" so the challenge is offered up to him. Tune in and hear Magic Hat's "Dude of Dichotomy" Matt Cohen talk about the beer and find out if Chad was able to clone this great seasonal Amber Ale.

episodes.title: Stone Arrogant Bastard - Can You Brew It 08-31-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This week on Can You Brew It Jamil and Tasty are faced with one of their toughest challenges yet: Arrogant Bastard from Stone Brewing Company. Stone has been hush hush about this recipe for years now, and while many clone recipes have been circulated around the web, our crew found all of them to be lacking. In this attempt, we get as much help as possible from Brewmaster Mitch Steele, without violating Stone's privacy on this beer. But the rest is left up to our experts. Tune in and find out if the boys were able to get it right.

episodes.title: Deschutes Black Butte Porter - Can You Brew It 08-17-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. OBy popular demand, the Can You Brew It crew revisits Deschutes Brewery to attempt to clone their beautiful Black Butte Porter. Brewer Jimmy Seifrits joins the discussion to reveal the intricacies of the beer and Tasty sets out to brew it. Will he succeed? Tune in and find out!

episodes.title: Magic Hat Number 9 - Can You Brew It 08-03-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. On this episode of Can You Brew It Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone an east coast favorite; Magic Hat's Number 9. It's a tricky apricot flavored ale that is perfect for summer, but difficult to get the fruit character just right. Tune in to hear Magic Hat's "Dude of Dichotomy" talk to the guys about the beer and see if they were able to clone it.

episodes.title: Oksar Blues Gordon - Can You Brew It 07-20-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. On this episode of Can You Brew It Jamil, Tasty McDole and guest brewer Nathan Smith attempt to clone the great Gordon from Oskar Blues Brewing Company. It's a challenging and complex beer to recreate, and even with help from the brewmaster, our brewers are pushed on this one. Tune in to find out if they did it!

episodes.title: Rogue Dead Guy Ale - Can You Brew It 06-22-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone Rogue's Dead Guy Ale on this episode of Can You Brew It. Tune in to hear Brewmaster John Maier talk about the beer and find out if the crew was able to clone it for you!

episodes.title: Ballast Point Calico Amber - Can You Brew It 06-08-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of The Jamil Show: Can You Brew It, Jamil and Tasty McDole attempt to clone Ballast Point's Calico Amber Ale. Ballast Point, in San Diego, makes some of the finest beers the west coast has to offer, and Calico Amber is one their most popular.
