Tune in to here brewer Yuseff Cherney talk about the beer and see if the CYBI crew can clone it.

episodes.title: Deschutes Obsidian Stout - Can You Brew It 05-25-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Tasty attempt to brew listener favorite, Obsidian Stout, from Deschutes Brewing in Oregon on this episode Can You Brew It. Deschutes brewer Jimmy Seifrit joins the program to instruct our hosts and give his take on how to get the job done right at home.

episodes.title: Lagunitas Brown Shugga - Can You Brew It 05-11-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this third episode of our Lagunitas series, Jamil and Tasty McDole attempt to clone Brown Shugga. This beer is complex in flavor and brewing technique, putting the Brewcasters to the test. Tune in to here lagunitas brewer Jeremy Marshal talk about the origins of the beer and how it is made in the brewery. Then find out of Tasty and Jamil were able to get it right...

episodes.title: Lagunitas IPA - Can You Brew It 04-27-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Tasty continue their Laguntas series with the challenge of brewing their IPA. Lagunitas brewer Jeremy Marshal joins the show to talk about the characteristics and ingredients of the beer and the boys attempt to clone it.

episodes.title: Lagunitas Censored Ale - Can You Brew It 04-13-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. By popular demand, and because we love them too, Jamil and Tasty begin a series on brewing the fine beers of Lagunitas Brewing Company in Petaluma, CA. Accepting the challenges of listeners to clone their beers, Tasty and Jamil begin with an attempt to recreate Lagunitas Censored Ale. Tune in and hear brewmaster Jeremy Marshal's take on the beer and see if the guys were able to brew this west coast favorite.

episodes.title: Flossmoor Station Pullman Brown - Can You Brew It 03-30-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of The Jamil Show: Can You Brew It, the Jamil and Tasty are challenged to brew Flossmoor Station's Pullman Brown, nut brown ale. After speaking with Brewmaster Matt Van Wyk about the ingredients, Jamil sets off to brew this great brown ale. Tune in to find out what special ingredients Matt uses and to see if Jamil was able to clone it.

episodes.title: Green Flash West Coast IPA - Can You Brew It 03-16-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone Green Flash West Coast IPA in this episode of Can You Brew It. This beer is truly a west coast style IPA with tons of green hop flavor and distinct bitterness. The guys interview Brewmaster Chuck Silva from Green Flash to get the scoop and enlist talented IPA homebrewer Nathan Smith to help with the clone. Did the boys get it right this time? Tune in and find out...

episodes.title: Firestone DBA - Can You Brew It 03-02-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode of Can You Brew It?, Jamil and Tasty attempt to clone Firestone Walker's Double Barrel Ale (DBA). Firestone Brewmaster Matt Brynildson joins the program to help in the guys' attempt to brew this fine beer at home

episodes.title: Moose Drool - Can You Brew It 02-16-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This is the premier of the all new Jamil Show: Can You Brew It? Jamil and Tasty McDole join forces to clone the worlds best beers so you can brew them at home. This premier event features  Moose Drool from Big Sky Brewing Co. and everything you need to know to brew it yourself. Tune in to find out if the guys succeeded in making their own clone.

episodes.title: Oz Sparkling Ale - The Jamil Show 02-02-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Weeeeeell....maybe just one more show. Jamil and Jon come back to cover a couple of listener requests and bring it strong with one more show; Australian Sparkling Ale. Join the guys once  more as they do their best to cover all the styles you want to hear along with special guest Peter Symons from Australia to help cover the style.

episodes.title: Cider AGAIN - The Jamil Show 01-19-09
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. For obvious reasons, if you heard the last Jamil Show, the two steadfast hosts of The Jamil Show have returned once again to ACTUALLY cover the cider style from the BJCP guidelines. To keep them in line and lend his expertise, Jamil and Jon are joined by two time NHC Gold medal cider maker Gary Awdey. This time the boys do the topic justice...and also announce an all new Jamil Show...

episodes.title: Cider - The Jamil Show 12-15-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. It's the end of an era at The BN as Jamil Zainasheff and Jon Plise cover their last BJCP style, Cider. Listen in as the crew goes...more than a little crazy in celebration of the last Jamil Show. Jamil cuts loose, guests show up to wish farewell, callers do the same, and Jon Plise gets credit for the whole thing...who woulda thunk? Oh yea, and they talk a little about cider too.

episodes.title: Mead - The Jamil Show 12-01-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In the second to last episode of The Jamil Show, Jamil and Jon are almost done with every style in the BJCP Style Guidelines and come one step close with this coverage of Mead. Author of The Compete Mead Maker and mead expert Ken Schramm also joins the program and ads his expertise on this ancient fermented beverage.

episodes.title: Belgian Tripel - The Jamil Show 11-16-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon cover brewing a Belgian Tripel style of beer in this episode of The Jamil Show

episodes.title: Foreign Extra Stout - The Jamil Show 11-03-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon cover brewing Foreign Extra Stout in this episode of The Jamil Show

episodes.title: Traditional Bock - The Jamil Show 10-20-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon cover brewing a Traditional Bock style of beer in this episode of The Jamil Show

episodes.title: Flanders Brown Ale/Oud Bruin - The Jamil Show 10-06-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon cover brewing a Flanders Brown Ale/Oud Bruin style of beer in this episode of The Jamil Show

episodes.title: English IPA - The Jamil Show 09-22-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon cover brewing English IPA in this episode of The Jamil Show

episodes.title: Belgian Dubbel - The Jamil Show 09-08-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon cover brewing the BJCP beer style Belgian Dubbel in this episode of The Jamil Show

episodes.title: Old Ale - The Jamil Show 08-25-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Old Ale is covered in this edition of The Jamil Show.

episodes.title: North German Altbier - The Jamil Show 08-11-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. North German Altbier is a very clean and somewhat bitter beer, balanced by a full malt character. Jamil is still sounding pretty weak, but he Jon give an award winning recipe and also talk about the upcoming 2009 National Homebrew Conference to be held in their area.

episodes.title: Belgian Blond Ale - The Jamil Show 07-28-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jon and Jamil discuss Belgian Blond Ale, which is a golden ale with a subtle Belgian complexity, slightly sweet flavor, and a dry finish. They enjoy a wonderful commercial example and give an award winning recipe. Jon and Jamil also talk about their weak results from the 2008 NHC.

episodes.title: American Stout - The Jamil Show 07-14-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Careful, this one has some EXPLICIT moments, so don't play it around work or the kids. Jon and Jamil cover American Stout, which is a somewhat hoppy, bitter and strongly roasted stout. Jamil also describes his trip to the hospital emergency room and why he missed the NHC this year.

episodes.title: Vienna Lager - The Jamil Show 06-30-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. An episode broadcast live from the National Homebrew Competition! Unfortunately Jamil was still at home, with pneumonia. But fear not... Doctor Scot, Ray Daniels, Jon Plise, and Justin Crosley host the show in his absence. Vienna lager is similar to Oktoberfest, but with a lighter malt character overall. It is still decidedly balanced toward malt and characterized by a soft, elegant maltiness that dries out in the finish to avoid becoming sweet. A great beer style and this show includes several recipes for making a winning version.

episodes.title: Belgian Specialty Ale - The Jamil Show 06-16-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Belgian Specialty Ale is a BJCP category that encompasses a wide range of Belgian ales produced by truly artisanal brewers creating unique products. Jamil gives an Orval clone recipe.

episodes.title: Lambic, Gueuze, Fruit Lambic - The Jamil Show 06-02-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Lambic is a very complex, sour/acidic, pale, wheat-based ale fermented by a variety of Belgian microbiota. Jamil talks about the longshot and Chad temporarily sits in for Jon, who is delayed by police activity.

episodes.title: Baltic Porter - The Jamil Show 05-19-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Baltic Porter is a very complex, multi-layered beer. It is malty, with restrained roast notes and a substantial OG and alcohol content. Jamil tells a story about his grandparents.

episodes.title: Irish Red Ale - The Jamil Show 05-05-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Irish Red Ale is an easy drinking beer, with an up front malty sweetness and a dry finish. Jamil explains why the beer he entered shouldn't have taken first place for this style.

episodes.title: Classic Rauchbier - The Jamil Show 04-21-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Classic rauchbier is an Oktoberfest-style beer with a rich smoke malt character. Done right, it is a fantastic beer. Listen to this show to avoid common pitfalls when brewing this style.

episodes.title: Dunkelweizen - The Jamil Show 04-07-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Dunkelweizen is a mahogany to copper colored, spicy, fruity, malty wheat-based ale. It has the fermentation character of a hefeweizen blended with the malty richness of a Munich dunkel.

episodes.title: Special Bitter - The Jamil Show 03-24-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Special bitter is a flavorful, yet refreshing, English session beer.

episodes.title: Biere de Garde - The Jamil Show 03-10-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Biere de Garde is traditional artisanal farmhouse ale from Northern France. It is a fairly strong, malty beer. Jamil provides an award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Doppelbock - The Jamil Show 02-25-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Doppelbock is a very strong, malty and rich lager. Jamil provides an award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Oatmeal Stout - The Jamil Show 02-11-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Oatmeal stout is a very dark, full-bodied, roasty, malty ale. Jamil provides an award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Northern English Brown Ale - The Jamil Show 01-28-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Newcastle anyone? How about Sam Smiths Nut Brown ale? Those are two excellent examples of Northern English Brown Ales. Jamil provides an award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Munich Dunkel - The Jamil Show 01-14-08
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. One of my favorite sytles, Munich Dunkel is a rich beer with a big bready Munich malt character. Jamil provides his simple, but award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Belgian Golden Strong Ale - The Jamil Show 12-31-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This is one devil of a beer. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing this strong, but highly drinkable Belgian treat. Jamil provides his award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Strong Scotch Ale - The Jamil Show 12-17-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing award winning Strong Scotch Ale. This is a great rich and malty style for the winter months. Jon provides his award winning recipe for this style.

episodes.title: Weizenbock - The Jamil Show 12-03-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Sam Adams Longshot winner Rodney Kibzey joins us to discuss his recipe and technique for brewing his award winning Weizenbock. This style is rich, malty and full of dark fruit flavors. Warming alcohol makes it a great cool weather beer.

episodes.title: Dortmunder Export - The Jamil Show 11-19-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Dortmunder Export is all about balance, but is still a bold and flavorful German lager. Tasty McDole joins Jamil and Jon in the studio to discuss brewing this style. Jamil and Mike provide two recipes for brewing award winning Dortmunder Export beers.

episodes.title: American Lagers - The Jamil Show 11-05-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. American Lagers are a tricky beer to brew, not much flavor to hide behind. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing this style and tricks for making an award winning sample.

episodes.title: Brown Porter - The Jamil Show 10-22-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Brown Porter is a fairly substantial English dark ale with restrained roasty characteristics. A missunderstood style by many, but it is always a wonderful pint day in and day out. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing this style and tricks for making an award winning sample.

episodes.title: Berliner Weisse - The Jamil Show 10-08-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Berliner Weisse is a light, refreshing German sour wheat ale. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing this style and tricks for making an award winning sample.

episodes.title: Winter Spiced Beer - The Jamil Show 09-24-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Just in time for Christmas, Jamil and Jon discuss brewing Winter Spiced Beers. These are rich, warming beers similar to holiday cookies and other treats.

episodes.title: Saison - The Jamil Show 09-10-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Saison is a wonderful, refreshing beer with spicy and fruity notes from the fermentation. Jamil and Jon discuss award winning techniques and recipes for this style. A surprise guest, Dr. Chris White shows up near the end of the show. Jamil and Chris answer yeast questions from the live listeners and discuss a number of yeasty topics for an additional 30 minutes. Thanks Chris for stopping by.

episodes.title: American Wheat or Rye - The Jamil Show 08-27-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing American wheat or rye beer. This is a great, easy drinking beer that is popular with all types of beer drinkers. Jamil also talks about brewing his Belgian strong dark ale at the 21st Amendment in San Francisco and his interesting, finance driven diet as a college student.

episodes.title: Sweet Stout - The Jamil Show 08-13-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing sweet stout. Also known as milk stout, this beer includes lactose in this award winning recipe. Jamil also talks about his family RV trip and the great beers he sampled along the way.

episodes.title: Wood Aged Beer - The Jamil Show 07-30-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon discuss wood aging beers using chips, cubes or barrels. Barrel treatments, sanitizing wood cubes. The beers of Wyoming.

episodes.title: English Barleywine - The Jamil Show 07-16-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil and Jon discuss brewing the richest of the English ales, English Barleywine. This is a rich, malty, complex, big beer. This episode features Jamil's award winning recipe and Jamil talks about his experiences at the National Homebrewers Conference in Denver.

episodes.title: American IPA - The Jamil Show 07-02-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil, Jon, and special guest Mike McDole discuss tips for brewing American IPA and what makes a great IPA. This episode features Mike McDole's award winning IPA recipe. Jamil reveals his very last brewing secret and other brewing tips.

episodes.title: German Pilsner - The Jamil Show 06-18-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. German Pilsner is a crisp, clean, refreshing beer with a prominent German noble hop bitterness. This episode covers Jon Plise's award winning recipe, discussions of beer around the world, and brewing tips.

episodes.title: Blonde Ale - The Jamil Show 06-06-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Brewing Blonde Ale. An easy drinking beer and a great introduction to craft brew.

episodes.title: Extra Special-Strong Bitter - The Jamil Show 05-21-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Brewing Extra Special-Strong Bitter (English Pale Ale). Similar to the other bitters, strong bitter has balanced, but firm hop bitterness and moderate hop character. This style very often has significant caramel malt sweetness and a complex biscuity, toasty, nutty malt character in the background.

episodes.title: Specialty Beer - The Jamil Show 05-07-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. All about specialty style beers. Includes a recipe for Black Forest Stout, which is a Cherry and Chocolate stout.

episodes.title: Bohemian Pilsener - The Jamil Show 04-23-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Czech or Bohemian-style Pilsener is one of those styles that many new brewers want to learn to brew perfectly. While still crisp and clean like other Pilsener-style beers, Bohemian-style Pilsener has a nice, rich, complex malt and spicy hop character.

episodes.title: Southern English Brown - The Jamil Show 04-09-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Southern English Brown is a luscious, malt-oriented brown ale, with a caramel, dark fruit complexity of malt flavor. Jamil and Jon explain how to brew a great Southern English Brown, discuss pH meters, revisiting Flanders Red in plastic buckets, and other brewing tips.

episodes.title: Belgian Strong Dark - The Jamil Show 03-26-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Belgian Strong Dark ale is a dark, rich, smooth, complex, very strong Belgian ale. Jamil, Jon and guest host Doctor Scott explain how to brew a great Belgian Strong Dark ale.

episodes.title: American Amber Ale - The Jamil Show 03-12-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. American Amber west coast style. This is a balanced, hoppy ale with touches of caramel and toasted malt. Jamil, Jon and guest host Doctor Scott explain how to brew a great American Amber.

episodes.title: Eisbock - The Jamil Show 02-26-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Eisbock is a huge, malty German style lager, similar to a Doppelbock, but with more mouthfeel, more malt and more alcohol. It is a great beer, but it can be tricky to brew. Jamil and Jon explain how to brew a great Eisbock and loads of brewing tips.

episodes.title: Roggenbier - The Jamil Show 02-12-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Roggenbier is German style, similar to a Bavarian Weizen, but with more mouthfeel and a slight rye spicy note. A great beer. Jamil and Jon explain how to brew a great Roggenbier and loads of brewing tips.

episodes.title: Flanders Red Ale - The Jamil Show 01-29-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Flanders Red Ale is a deliciously sour and slightly funky beer. Rodenbach makes a great example of this style. Jamil and Jon explain how to brew a great Flanders Red.

episodes.title: American Barleywine - The Jamil Show 01-15-07
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The first show of 2007. Jamil and Jon discuss the tricks for brewing a great American Barleywine. This is a huge beer, with lots of malt character, hops and alcohol. A beer to sip, not gulp.

episodes.title: Cream Ale - The Jamil Show 12-18-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Cream Ale has nothing to do with vanilla or any other soda flavors. This is a clean, crisp and very refreshing ale with restrained hop notes. Jamil and Jon talk about what makes a great cream ale. The final show for 2006.

episodes.title: Other Smoked Beers - The Jamil Show 12-04-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Smoke em if you got em. Jamil and Jon talk about what makes a great smoked beer (this episode covers other smoked beers, not classic rauch beer). Includes an award winning recipe for Smoked Porter.

episodes.title: Schwarzbier - The Jamil Show 11-20-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This is a great episode as Jamil and Jon talk about one of Jamil's favorite styles, German Schwarzbier. This black lager is smooth, malty, slightly hoppy, with a very tiny bit of roast flavor. Includes an award winning recipe used by both amateur and professional brewers to win numerous awards.

episodes.title: Standard Cider - The Jamil Show 11-06-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode Jamil and Jon take a break from beer and discuss another favorite fermented beverage, cider. Yeasts, sources for apple juice and techniques for adjusting the sweetness.

episodes.title: Spice Beer - The Jamil Show 10-23-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode Jamil and Jon discuss how to make spiced beers. What is it that makes a great spice beer? Techniques for adding spices without overwhelming the beer.

episodes.title: Scottish Ales - The Jamil Show 10-09-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode Jamil and Jon discuss the world of Scottish Ales. These are low to moderate alcohol, malty, clean beers. Great for drinking in quantity and a great way to grow yeast. Mike McDole writes in with some brewing tips for making his award winning Imperial IPA.

episodes.title: Munich Helles - The Jamil Show 09-25-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode Jamil and Jon discuss how to make an award winning Munich Helles. Getting malty flavors in beer. Debunking common myths about malty favors versus body.

episodes.title: Imperial IPA - The Jamil Show 09-11-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode Jamil and Jon discuss how to make an award winning Imperial IPA. No more screwing around, we get back to focusing on the style at hand. Includes the Mike McDole Best of Show Imperial IPA recipe.

episodes.title: Belgian Pale Ale - The Jamil Show 08-28-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this episode Jamil and Jon discuss how to make an award winning Belgian Pale Ale. Reader email about carbonation problems, smoked porter recipes, shelf life of beer, and whole versus pellet hops. Jamil brings some 'whine' to the show and Jon's pathetic memory.

episodes.title: Mild - The Jamil Show 08-14-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Contrary to its name, Mild is a style rich in flavor and aroma. In this episode, Jamil and Jon discuss how to make an award winning English Mild Ale. Reader email about DMS, evaporation rates, and lagering. Jon's lack of morning coffee results in a weird fascination with pens.

episodes.title: California Common - The Jamil Show 07-31-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. This show is all about brewing a great California Common style beer. Includes some reader email, where to find recipes for the show, a great California Common recipe, mini-mashing Munich and Vienna malt, and some tips on using pale chocolate malt.

episodes.title: American Brown Ale - The Jamil Show 07-17-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. In this show Jamil and Jon cover brewing two different types of American Brown Ale. We cover the difference between commercial American Brown and homebrew American Brown Ales and provide two award winning recipes. Reader email on needing to mash Munich malt and Jon insults Jamil's looks.

episodes.title: Kolsch and Dusseldorf Altbier - The Jamil Show 06-19-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. A special two episode show. In this show Jamil and Jon cover brewing and enjoying both Kolsch and Dusseldorf Altbier. These two German ales are uniquely different and come from two towns in Germany just a stone's throw from each other. Reader email and Jamil's brewing fantasies.

episodes.title: Bavarian Weizen - The Jamil Show 06-05-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The secrets to brewing a Bavarian weizen. This bready ale is a traditional style of Southern Germany. Justin tells the story of the limo ride back from the anniversary party.

episodes.title: American Pilsner - The Jamil Show 05-22-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Brewing a Classic American Pilsner. Not like today's Bud, Miller or Coors, this is how American Pilsner was made before Prohibition. This is a malty, hoppy lager beer that is as delicious as it is American. A great brew for the 4th of July. Jon gets uppity. Jamil admits to throwing out lots of beer and describes Dave Sapsis funky wort chiller.

episodes.title: Robust Porter - The Jamil Show 05-08-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Robust Porter. Poor sick Jon and Nyquil. Winning with recipes.

episodes.title: Fruit Beers - The Jamil Show 04-24-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. How to make great fruit beers. When to use extract, real fruit or fruit puree. Adjusting the fruit to match the beer style.

episodes.title: American Pale Ale - The Jamil Show 04-10-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. American Pale Ales all about them and how to brew them.

episodes.title: Oktoberfest - The Jamil Show 03-27-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil is on vacation finding great beer in Europe while guest host Doctor Scott talks about brewing a great Oktoberfest beer.

episodes.title: Witbier - The Jamil Show 03-13-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. Jamil is on vacation finding great beer in Europe while guest host Doctor Scott talks about brewing a great Witbier.

episodes.title: Dry Stout - The Jamil Show 02-27-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. We discuss what makes a great Ordinary Bitter and how to brew it.

episodes.title: Maibock and Helles Bock - The Jamil Show 02-13-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. What makes a great maibock or helles bock.

episodes.title: Ordinary Bitter - The Jamil Show 01-30-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. We discuss what makes a great Ordinary Bitter and how to brew it.

episodes.title: Russian Imperial Stout - The Jamil Show 01-16-06
episodes.author: Jamil Zainasheff
episodes.summary: Homebrewing beer. The Jamil Show makes its debut on The Brewing Network and discusses Russian Imperial Stout as its first homebrew style.
